topic.title: Summary of contents
topic.para: describes the main functionality and purpose of &abbrev;.
discusses the technical concepts and philosophies behind &abbrev;.
describes how to install &abbrev; on various UNIX-based platforms using the precompiled binaries.
provides a briefly explains how to perform the most common log collecting tasks with &abbrev;.
discusses the configuration file format and syntax in detail, and explains how to manage large-scale configurations using included files and reusable configuration snippets.
explains how to collect and receive log messages from various sources.
describes the different methods to store and forward log messages.
explains how to route and sort log messages, and how to use filters to select specific messages.
lists the global options of &abbrev; and explains how to use them.
shows how to secure and authenticate log transport using TLS encryption.
describes how to customize message format using templates and macros, how to rewrite and modify messages, and how to use regular expressions.
describes how to segment and process structured messages like comma-separated values.
explains how to identify and process log messages using a pattern database.
details the available statistics that &abbrev; collects about the processed log messages.
describes how to configure &abbrev; to use multiple processors, and how to optimize its performance.
offers tips to solving problems.
gives recommendations to configure special features of &abbrev;.
